title: E0613 needs to be merged into E0609 now

labels.name: E-easy
labels.description: Call for participation: Experience needed to fix: Easy / not much (good first issue)

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: E-mentor
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue has a mentor. Use RustcContributor::new on Zulip for discussion.

body:
With RFC 1506 merged and stabilized, handling `E0613` separate from `E0609` is not the correct behaviour any more.

For context, you get `E0613` when doing something like `let _ = "hi".0;`:

```
error[E0613]: attempted to access tuple index `0` on type `&'static str`, but the type was not a tuple or tuple struct
```

And you get `E0609` when doing something like `let _ = "hi".foo;`:

```
error[E0609]: no field `foo` on type `&'static str`
```

[RFC 1506 "clarified ADT kinds"](https://github.com/rust-lang/rfcs/pull/1506) ([Rendered](https://github.com/rust-lang/rfcs/blob/master/text/1506-adt-kinds.md), [tracking issue](https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/35626)) allowed all structs to contain fields with integral names like `0` or `1`, etc. This makes the error message for `E0613` outdated, as the type may be a non tuple struct, and calling `0` a "tuple index" sounds wrong as well.

So I propose `E0613` to be merged into `E0609`, as `E0609` is now better suiting, and also because its "in the spirit" of the RFC.

The proposed new output for `let _ = "hi".0;` is:
 
```
error[E0609]: no field `0` on type `&'static str`
```
